full_summary:
# **Tower & Pier Demolition Contract - Amendment 2**

## **Overview**

Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) invites contractors to submit qualifications for the second phase of the Tower and Pier Demolition contract in Callander, Ontario. The project involves the removal and transportation of the existing Aid to Navigation Tower, demolition of the wooden foundation/dock, and other environmental remediation activities. 

## **Contract Details**

*   **Contracting Entity**: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
*   **Region**: Ontario (except National Capital Region)
*   **Contact Information**:
    *   Name: Claire Lavoie
    *   Email: [DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
    *   Phone: Not provided
    *   Fax: Not provided
    *   Address:
        *   Building 301
        *   301 Bishop Drive
        *   Fredericton, New Brunswick (E3C 2M6)
*   **Contract Description**:
    *   Phase 1 evaluates contractor qualifications.
    *   Phase 2 invites qualified contractors to submit a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings.
    *   Removal and transportation of the existing Aid to Navigation Tower
    *   Demolition of the existing wooden foundation/dock and other abandoned concrete foundations
    *   Environmental remediation, including the installation of new rip-rap to build up the existing breakwater and installation of new concrete foundations
    *   The town of Callander is repairing the breakwater that has also been in disrepair for some time.
*   **Timeline**:
    *   Contract duration: The contractor must complete the work by September 29th, 2023.
*   **Submission Instructions**:
    *   Contractors must submit their qualifications by March 8th, 2023, at 13:00 Eastern Time.
    *   Refer to the tender notice for complete instructions and supporting documentation.

## **Important Information**

*   The existing Aid to Navigation Tower is positioned on a wooden dock that has been damaged and in disrepair for some time, posing a high safety risk.
*   Environmental remediation includes the installation of new rip-rap to build up existing breakwater.
*   No further notice will be issued.
*   This announcement is open and competing. All qualified contractors are encouraged to submit their qualifications
